topics.body: also i just started playing kerbal space program and i dont know what im doing
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54795300636872273b3f0100#post_54795300636872273b3f0100
Tl:dr; use struts for structural integrity; eject any parts once they run out of fuel; your rocket needs to be bottom heavy and the smaller your satellite or whatever the less fuel it uses; the fuel lines are for pumping fuel inbetween rocket parts and you can use it to make staged rockets so that when fuel tanks 1 & 2 are empty you can eject them to make it lighter and make the rocket more effecient, then 3 & 4 are ejected to make it lighter, 5 & 6 are ejected to make it lighter, then the central rocket helps get you finally into orbit; the next stage of the rocket is for going to other planets.

An example of what I mean:
!http://www.google.com/url?sa=i&source=images&cd=&ved=0CAUQjBw4DA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fcloud-2.steampowered.com%2Fugc%2F540703713409907995%2F8D2242711A2C50E66625275CE57D7D6D707A03A7%2F&ei=sVR5VOCkNoKlNvqMguAB&psig=AFQjCNGnW1lvYBx8tBvqGuIVelMdDt-KBg&ust=1417324082122278!

Tl:dr of everything: make a six stage rocket.

topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547956136368724d18010000#post_547956136368724d18010000
You're actually on a good start; also do *NOT* floor it because the faster you go the more air resistance you meet making it less efficient.

You can actually manage to get to the moon on a new career game, but it's really hard to do honestly.
